resources.string:
As any seasoned player will tell you, Phasmophobia is a unique horror game developed by Kinetic Games.

P.E.T. is an unofficial companion tool\-\- acting both as a guide for new players and as an assistant for the veterans.

Thank you so much for using P.E.T.!
Allow Message Center to use Mobile Data

Banshees are described as natural hunters. They will attempt to slowly stalk and pick off ghost hunters one by one by selectively targeting one investigator at a time. Banshees fear the Crucifix, increasing its effectiveness against them.

A Demon is one of the worst ghosts to encounter. Being highly aggressive, it will attack more often than any other Ghost, so a crucifix is recommended to prevent Hunts. However, asking the demon successful questions from the Ouija Board will not drain the player\'s sanity.
A Goryo heavily dislikes showing itself when people are nearby. This makes seeing D.O.T.S. impossible without viewing the projector through a video camera remotely.

The Hantu favors colder temperatures which will empower its ability to move quickly. This means that the Circuit Breaker must be enabled in order to increase the overall temperature outside of the haunted area, thereby impairing the Hantu\'s movement speed.

A Jinn is a territorial ghost that will attack when threatened. It has also been known to be able to travel at high speeds, and will do so while hunting distant paranormal investigators. However, cutting off power via the fuse box will limit its speed.

The source of all nightmares, a Mare is a ghost that grows more aggressive in the dark. Keeping the lights on and remaining out of dark areas will limit its aggression. Beware, as it will also attempt to turn the lights off to empower itself.

The Myling will emit strange noises which can be picked up by the Parabolic Microphone. Its footsteps can also only be heard within the electronic interference range (which is around 10 meters) during a Hunt.

An Obake is a shape shifter which promotes some unusual evidence at times. By chance, an Obake may sometimes leave 6-fingered handprints instead of the normal 5. 5-fingered handprints should not be used to rule out the Obake.

An Oni is an aggressive ghost who scales its activity level with the number of nearby investigators. This is its greatest weakness, as it will likely reveal itself early in the round. It is also likely to wander around near the Ghost Room.
The Onryo both dislikes and is highly threatened by any form of flame (including candles, lighter, etc).

A Phantom is a fear-inducing ghost, quickly draining the sanity of those who view it. Taking a picture of it will make it disappear temporarily. Although rumored to possess the living, it has no ability to actually do so. It is said to be commonly summoned by a Ouija Board, although players cannot summon one themselves, nor does a Phantom\'s presence guarantee that a Ouija Board will spawn.
One of the most famous ghosts, a Poltergeist, also known as a noisy ghost, can manipulate multiple objects around it to spread fear into its victims.
A Raiju is a ghost which siphons electrical power from the devices around it. Too much electrical stimulation nearby it will cause it to become agitated and hunt more frequently.

A Revenant is a violent ghost that can attack indiscriminately, as it is capable of switching its current target mid-hunt. Hiding from it will cause it to move slowly, but it will travel faster than any other Ghost in the game if a victim is in its sights.
A Shade is considered to be a \"shy ghost\”. While it is harder to find evidence while investigators remain in groups, a Shade is far less likely to attack if there are multiple people nearby.

A Spirit is the most common Ghost you will come across, but it is still very powerful and dangerous. It is usually discovered at one of its hunting grounds after an unexplained death. It has no special strengths. Smudge sticks prevent Spirits from hunting for about three minutes.

The Twins are a pair of two Ghosts which have the ability to separately manipulate their surroundings. One of the Twins is unable to manipulate motion sensors and will not leave deterministic Evidence. Either Twin may initiate and participate in a Hunt, but not both at the same time.

A Wraith is one of the most dangerous ghosts you will find. It is the only known Ghost that has the ability of flight, and has sometimes been known to see through doors and go through walls. Salt is toxic to a Wraith.
The Yokai is highly sensitive to voices, making the Yokai extremely dangerous. However, speaking nearby it may also trigger activity, making finding the Ghost room easier.

A Yurei is a ghost whose ability increases the passive drain of a player\'s sanity (Although most ghosts drain your sanity rather quickly). Smudging the room a Yurei was found in will prevent it from wandering from the location for a long time.
Strength: Will focus on one player, especially those who attempt to confront the Banshee alone.
Strength: They can be difficult to gather clues on as they will attack players very frequently.
Strength: A Goryo often only shows itself on camera when there are no people nearby.
Strength: Lower temperatures allow the Hantu to move at faster speeds.
Strength: A Jinn\'s speed makes it an extremely difficult ghost to escape from once it begins hunting.
Strength: Mares thrive in the darkness, and will very likely begin to attack as soon as the lights go out.
Strength: A Myling is not as vocal as other Ghosts while Hunting.
Strength: An Obake may not leave a trace when manipulating the environment.

Strength: Onis possess the ability to move physical objects around like a Poltergeist, while also sporting the aggression of a Demon. This makes them challenging to gather evidence around without angering them.
Strength: Should a flame be extinguished, by any means, the Onryo may initiate a Hunt.
Strength: Phantoms will take an extreme toll on players\' sanity. Avoid being in the presence of, or looking directly at a Phantom for too long.
Strength: Poltergeists can have a heavy influence on the space players are in, being capable of throwing numerous objects as well as producing loud noises.
Strength: Raijus become much faster while nearby electrical devices.
Strength: Revenants will move extremely quickly when they begin attacking, giving players little chance of escaping.
Strength: Shades can be difficult to find, and therefore difficult to collect evidence on.
Strength: Spirits have no strengths in particular, as they are geared towards new players.
Strength: Either Twin may be angered, and thus, either Twin may initiate a Hunt.
Strength: Since they fly, Wraiths cannot be tracked by their footsteps.
Strength: Speaking nearby a Yokai will anger it. Multiple voices will speed up this process, which may easily surpass the protections of high Sanity levels.
Strength: Yureis will drop players\' sanity while they are looking at it quicker than any other ghost, but can also decrease sanity even when a player is turned away.
Weakness: Susceptible to the use of a crucifix to cull their aggression.
Weakness: Unlike other ghosts, asking a Demon a successful question via the Ouija Board will not lower players\' sanity. This makes the Ouija Board a very useful tool against Demons.
Weakness: Goryo\'s will normally stay within or very close to the location they\'re haunting.
Weakness: A Hantu\'s movement will be slower than normal in warmer areas.
Weakness: Jinns rely on the map\'s power source to achieve their high speeds, so players should look for the building\'s circuit breaker in order to limit the Jinn\'s abilities.
Weakness: Keeping the lights on in a Mare\'s area will lower the likelihood that it starts to hunt.
Weakness: Mylings will more frequently emit paranormal sounds.
Weakness: The unique evidence left by an Obake may be used to determine the Ghost type.
Weakness: Onis are easy to find, as they can\'t resist causing a ruckus when players are nearby.
Weakness: A flame will act to quell an Onryo\'s chance to attack, but this action comes with consequences.
Weakness: Taking a photo of a Phantom will cause it to temporarily disappear, giving players an opportunity to escape.
Weakness: Players can remove physical objects in the room, rendering a Poltergeist ineffective.
Weakness: It\'s easier to track a Raiju because they constantly manipulate electrical devices while hunting.
Weakness: If players do get the opportunity to hide from a Revenant, it\'s speed will drastically decrease.
Weakness: There\'s strength in numbers against a Shade, as they will not attack a group of people.
Weakness: Smudge Sticks will prevent Spirits from attacking for a period of time, allowing players to freely collect evidence.
Weakness: Due to their combined activity, locating The Twins should be much easier.
Weakness: Wraiths are weak to salt, and will stop attacking upon coming into contact with it. This can be easier said than done, however, as the Wraith will typically fly right over salt piles.
Weakness: While Hunting, a Yokai will only hear voices within a close proximity to it.
Weakness: Yureis are vulnerable to Smudge Sticks, and smudging the room successfully will cause the Yurei to remain in place for some time.

The D.O.T.S. Projector is a device which may be placed on walls or the floor. It projects a matrix of bright dots, casting the dots across nearby surfaces around it.

To positively identify this Evidence, a silhouette of the ghost will be seen running, or crawling quickly, through the projection\'s beams. The silhouette may be seen by the naked eye or through a Video Camera, but is easier seen remotely via the Video Camera\'s Thermals. It\'s best to attempt to find this evidence remotely, as a Goryo\'s behavior may cause Evidence conflicts otherwise. The actual location of the Ghost will not dictate when the silhouette animations occur.

EMF-5 is the highest Level reading from an EMF Reader.

A ghost produces EMF emissions from Levels 1 through 5 when it interacts in some way with the room or the Ouija Board. Light flickers, footsteps and other smaller passive interactions will typically give a lower reading. Heavier interactions, such as an appearance or a phone ringing, will almost always give a higher reading. Ghosts carrying this evidence will give EMF Level 5 only by chance, so this evidence may take some time to acquire.

Left on objects and surfaces by ghosts, Fingerprints can only be seen by shining the UV Light or a Glowstick onto affected surfaces and will glow green while under UV light.

The evidence might be tough to see on smaller items, and the evidence might fade after a while. If you\'re having trouble locating Fingerprints, using a Photo Camera on items such as a dinner table containing dinnerware or jars might procure evidence, as the journal might write \"Fingerprints\" the photos. Confusingly, Footprints also show up under UV light and count as interactions in the journal, but Footprints do not count as evidence towards Fingerprints. A 6-fingered Handprint may be found which will identify the Ghost type immediately as an Obake.

Freezing temperatures are below 0 Celsius. Temperature can be determined by using the Thermometer.

As ghosts pull heat from the surrounding area, temperatures decrease in the room or hallways where the ghost spends the most of its time. All ghosts will eventually cause temperatures below 13 degrees Celsius, but only certain ghost types will drop temperatures below 0 C. These freezing temperatures will allow everyone within the haunted area to see their breath. The cooling of a room, even by just a slight amount, may take longer than the first few minutes during an investigation. Taking note of oddly low temperatures in early rooms and then doubling back to them is a good idea.

Determined using the Ghost Writing Book.

Ghosts may write in the book regardless if the book is set down or held in hand. If the ghost writes in the book, this is a piece of Evidence for that ghost type. If Demonic symbols are written, this may be evidence for a Demon, but this is absolutely not definitive as ghost writing styles tend to deviate at random.

A small, floating orb that\'s present only in the room a ghost is haunting. It can be seen only via night vision through Thermals on the Video Camera or Head-Mounted Camera truck feed.

Ghost orbs can be quick to spot, but ruling it out too quickly might spell trouble down the road.

The Spirit Box is item used to communicate with the ghost.

A player must ask questions in Vicinity Chat to an active Spirit Box, both while nearby the ghost and while the lights are off. Before attempting this, check the ghost\'s response parameters such as either \"Responds to people who are alone\" or \"Responds to everyone\" listed on the Truck\'s whiteboard. Should the ghost answer, the Spirit Box is confirmed Evidence. Pointed questions such as \"How old are you?\" or \"Where are you?\" are plausible questions. Do keep in mind that the ghost is always listening regardless if a player is talking into a Spirit Box or not, so players should be careful while speaking in Vicinity chat. Drawing out a ghost can be done by saying their given name numerous times (thus, angering it), and giving it commands like \"Show yourself\" or \"Give us a sign\" seem to be plausible commands.
Prevent a hunt with the Crucifix
Have the Ghost walk through Salt
Escape the ghost while it\'s hunting
Repel the hunting ghost with a Smudge stick
Have the ghost blow out a candle
Get an Average Team Sanity of 25% or lower
Do you want to hurt us?
Are you the only one here?
What can we do to help?
